Row.Description: Review of OSS connection and related change logs to ensure only the correct system is enabled for SAP support.
Row.Risk: If SAPOSS access is enabled on unintended systems, it may allow unauthorized remote access by SAP or third parties, leading to potential data breaches or system compromise.
Row.ControlAction: Collect the ticket and approval email.

Row.Description: Monitoring for unauthorized client openings in production systems.
Row.Risk: An open client allows unrestricted configuration and data changes, bypassing change management processes and leading to potential fraud, data corruption, or audit failure.
Row.ControlAction: Attach the approval email and ticket number.

Row.Description: Review of emergency user ID (FFID) usage for legitimacy and completeness.
Row.Risk: Misuse or unmonitored use of emergency access can lead to untraceable high-risk changes, potentially resulting in financial loss, system manipulation, or compliance violations.

Row.ControlDefinition: Critical Transaction Usages in Production (CDHDR Report)
Row.Description: Monitoring execution of sensitive transactions (e.g., SA38, SE38) in production systems.
Row.Risk: Execution of critical transactions by unauthorized users can compromise system integrity, expose sensitive data, or disrupt business operations.

Row.Description: Assessment of the transport management and change approval process.
Row.Risk: Poorly controlled change transport processes can lead to unauthorized or erroneous changes in production, causing system outages or data integrity issues.

Row.Description: Identification of developer access (e.g., debug, change programs) in live environments.
Row.Risk: Developers with production access can bypass the standard development lifecycle, introduce unauthorized code, and potentially exploit system vulnerabilities.

Row.ControlDefinition: List of Users Having SAP_ALL and SAP_NEW Access for User type A(Dialog) and S(Service)
Row.Description: Identification of users with unrestricted profiles (SAP_ALL, SAP_NEW).
Row.Risk: These profiles override all security controls. If assigned inappropriately, they present a high risk of data manipulation, fraud, or complete system takeover.

Row.ControlDefinition: List of Users having Table Maintenance Access in Production
Row.Description: Identification of users with access to maintain SAP tables directly in production.
Row.Risk: Direct table changes may bypass application-level controls, leading to data inconsistencies, unauthorized changes, and audit exceptions.

Row.ControlDefinition: Users are authorized to execute programs based on their job responsibilities.
Row.Description: Review of user access to execute custom and standard SAP programs.
Row.Risk: Unjustified execution access can be used to run unauthorized or sensitive reports and programs, potentially exposing or altering sensitive business data.

Row.ControlDefinition: Ability to alter security configuration settings
Row.Description: Users with access to create/modify users, roles, and security settings in production.
Row.Risk: These privileges can be used to escalate access, override controls, or create unauthorized users, compromising system security and segregation of duties.

Row.ControlDefinition: Ability to import transports to production environment
Row.Description: Identification of users who can directly import transports into production.
Row.Risk: Direct transport imports by unauthorized users can bypass testing and approval processes, leading to unstable environments and increased operational risk.

Row.ControlDefinition: Ability to perform job administration functions (Maintenance) – SM37 with Admin Access
Row.Description: Access to monitor, schedule, and manage background jobs.
Row.Risk: Inappropriate access may allow users to stop, reschedule, or manipulate critical business jobs, resulting in operational disruptions or data processing failures.

Row.ControlDefinition: Ability to change password configuration settings – RZ10/RZ11 Change access
Row.Description: Access to change global password settings and profiles.
Row.Risk: Weakening password parameters (e.g., complexity, expiry) can increase exposure to brute-force attacks, reducing the overall security posture.

Row.ControlDefinition: Password Status for the below default SAP ID's
Row.Description: Review of status and password control for standard SAP IDs.
Row.Risk: These IDs are widely known and targeted; if left active with default credentials, they create a severe vulnerability for unauthorized system access.

Row.ControlDefinition: Access to maintain CUA landscape (SCUA) & Access to Maintain user distribution field selection (SCUM)
Row.Description: Access to manage central user administration and user distribution rules.
Row.Risk: Misuse or over-assignment of CUA access can result in inconsistent role assignments across systems or unauthorized user provisioning.

Row.Description: Monitoring changes made to SAP-delivered standard programs.
Row.Risk: Unapproved changes can make the system unsupported by SAP, introduce errors, and compromise system reliability.

Row.ControlDefinition: Authorizations to Modify IDOCs in Production
Row.Description: Identification of users who can change IDOCs in production systems.
Row.Risk: IDOC changes can alter data exchanged with external systems (e.g., vendors, customers), leading to financial discrepancies or reconciliation failures.

Row.Description: Ensuring access of terminated/transferred employees is deactivated timely.
Row.Risk: Retaining access for leavers creates a major security risk as it allows unauthorized access to sensitive data or systems, possibly resulting in misuse or data leakage.
